fields.description:
euare-usermod lets me modify whether a user is enabled or disabled with its {{\--enabled}} option, but it also lets me change the user's registration status to registered, approved, or confirmed with {{\--reg-status}}.  The latter is a holdover from pre-IAM Eucalyptus and the GUI-driven, self-service registration process that now no longer exists.  A user must be both confirmed and enabled to be able to interact with the system.

The combination of these two systems is redundant and confusing.  One of them should be removed.
fields.summary: Simultaneous existence of registered/approved/confirmed and enabled/disabled for users is confusing

comments.body: [~kedwards] to ping around to see what the state of the registration code is.
db schema change would be required, not a high priority item with high impact to upgrade.

[~gholms], do you have any thoughts on how the admin tools should be updated for this change; should the functionality be entirely removed from the tools or do we need to retain the related options and handle them somehow?

Registration status is no longer processed from requests or included in responses. The related euca2ools euare admin functionality should be removed.

Handling for upgrade will be implemented under EUCA-10683 later in 4.2 development.

Documentation updates are tracked by DOC-1556.
This isn't a major change to tools; I will simply update the "Eucalyptus only" disclaimer on euare-usermod's \-\-reg-status option to "Eucalyptus < 4.2 only".
